senses.de: The act or process of supplying something.
senses.ex: The school is accountable for the provision of an appropriate education to all students.

Tips.title: Contextual Use
Tips.description: Often found in business or service-related discussions, implying obligation.
Tips.example: The hotel's provision of free Wi-Fi was much appreciated.

Tips.title: Implying Responsibility
Tips.description: 'Provision' can suggest an entity is responsible for providing something.
Tips.example: The government's provision of healthcare is under debate.

senses.de: A condition or requirement in a legal document.
senses.ex: They failed to comply with the provisions of the contract.

Tips.title: Legal Importance
Tips.description: In legal texts, 'provision' is serious and binding, not to be overlooked.
Tips.example: The provisions of the will were strictly enforced.

Tips.title: Scripted Boundaries
Tips.description: Provisions set precise boundaries or rules within contracts.
Tips.example: The rental agreement includes a provision against pets.

senses.de: Food, drink or equipment needed for a journey or activity.
senses.ex: They made provisions for the long trip.

Tips.title: Practical Preparation
Tips.description: Relates to tangible items packed or taken for trips or events.
Tips.example: We packed extra provisions in case we get stranded.

Tips.title: Sufficiency
Tips.description: Reflects the need for adequate supplies for a specific duration.
Tips.example: He calculated the provisions needed for a week at sea.

senses.de: A store or supply of something, especially of food or clothing.
senses.ex: The refugee camps have enough provision to feed the people for a week.

Tips.title: Resource Availability
Tips.description: Highlights the existence of a supply that can be used when needed.
Tips.example: The shelter's provision of blankets was crucial during the winter.

senses.de: The action of preparing or planning in advance for something.
senses.ex: They made provision for their children's futures by setting up trust funds.

Tips.title: Future Oriented
Tips.description: Focus on actions taken now to benefit or safeguard the future.
Tips.example: Good parents make provision for their children's education.

Tips.title: Care and Foresight
Tips.description: Indicates careful planning for unpredictable circumstances.
Tips.example: The family made ample provision for potential emergencies.

Arrangement.wordDefinition:
Arrangement usually refers to the way things are organized or put together. For example, you may arrange the furniture in your room or make arrangements for a meeting.

Both words are used to describe the act of preparing or setting something up, but arrangement puts more emphasis on the organization of something while provision focuses on the act of making something available.

Cater.wordDefinition:
Cater means to prepare and provide food and drinks for an event or group of people.

The main difference between cater and provision is that catering focuses specifically on food and drink for an event, while provision can refer to a wider range of necessities.

Equipment.wordDefinition:
Equipment refers to tools, machinery, or other physical objects used to perform a task or activity. For example, a construction worker would use equipment such as a drill or a crane.

Equipment is the physical objects used to perform a task, while provision is the act of providing something that is needed.

Preparation.wordDefinition:
Preparation refers to the act of getting ready or making something ready in advance. It involves planning, organizing and making arrangements for the future.

Both preparation and provision are important in different situations. Preparation is applicable when planning for something that is yet to happen, while provision is applicable when dealing with a current or immediate need.

Stipulate.wordDefinition:
Both provision and stipulate refer to an agreement or a condition set forth in a contract or agreement.

Stipulate is similar, but it specifically refers to a condition that is explicitly stated in the agreement.

In other words, the parties have agreed upon a specific condition and have included it in the contract. For example, a contract may stipulate that a project must be completed by a certain date.

In general, provisions tend to be broader in scope than stipulations, and may include multiple conditions or requirements.

Stipulations are typically more specific and may only apply to a particular aspect of the agreement.

Stock.wordDefinition:
Stock refers to a supply of something that is kept on hand for future use or sale.

It can be applicable in situations like a retail store keeping a supply of clothing, a factory having a stock of raw materials or finished products, or an investor having a stock portfolio.

Subsistence.wordDefinition:
Subsistence, on the other hand, refers to the basic necessities of life that are needed to survive, such as food, water, and shelter.

For example, a family that has enough food to eat every day would be said to have provisions, while a family that is barely able to scrape together enough food to survive would be said to be living in subsistence.

The term "subsistence farming" is often used to describe a type of agriculture in which people grow only enough food to feed themselves and their families.

Supply.wordDefinition:
Supply refers to the act of providing something that is needed, usually in the present moment. For example, a store may supply products to customers who need them right now.

Provision is about planning ahead while supply is about meeting immediate needs.

quotes.Text: In my youth, I traveled much, and I observed in different countries, that the more public provisions were made for the poor, the less they provided for themselves, and of course became poorer. And, on the contrary, the less was done for them, the more they did for themselves, and became richer.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.Text: Our independence from AOL was so important to me that I negotiated an extremely odd provision in our purchase agreement that allowed me to disclose confidential information about AOL. It was their job never to give me that information. It was not my job to protect it in any way.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Michael Arrington

quotes.Text: One of the gaps in our international development efforts is the provision of global public goods - that is, goods or conditions we need that no individual or country can secure on their own, such as halting global warming, financial stability and peace and security.
quotes.Title: Swedish Politician
quotes.Name: Anna Lindh

quotes.Text: If we collectively set our minds to improving technology of a particular type we can do that, and it takes some collective action, some support for research, or some provision of patent protection, or a mixture of the two, and some focussed energy.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Paul Romer

quotes.Text: I had daydreams and fantasies when I was growing up. I always wanted to live in a log cabin at the foot of a mountain. I would ride my horse to town and pick up provisions. Then return to the cabin, with a big open fire, a record player and peace.
quotes.Title: American Photographer
quotes.Name: Linda McCartney

quotes.Text: This self-love is the instrument of our preservation; it resembles the provision for the perpetuity of mankind: it is necessary, it is dear to us, it gives us pleasure, and we must conceal it.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Voltaire

quotes.Text: Economic growth is very important, but it is not the only thing, and it must be accompanied by sharing with those who are left behind, through effective social services and provision.
quotes.Title: British Economist
quotes.Name: Angus Deaton

quotes.Text: In addition to the clean coal provisions, the energy conference agreement contains provisions instrumental in helping increase conservation and lowering consumption.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jerry Costello

quotes.Text: It is a universal truth that the loss of liberty at home is to be charged to the provisions against danger, real or pretended, from abroad.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: James Madison

quotes.Text: It is overwhelmingly women who will plug the gaps in care provision, sacrificing paid employment to look after family members.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Luciana Berger
